medical_history.chief_complaint: Increased aminotransferase levels indicating autoimmune hepatitis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient commenced antiretroviral therapy in April 2005; her alanine aminotransferase (ALT) level was initially 26 U/L. By January 18, 2006, her ALT level rose to 245 U/L. After antiretroviral therapy was discontinued, her ALT level peaked at 940 U/L on March 3, 2006.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Graves disease diagnosed in 1999, treated with radioactive iodine, and maintained on levothyroxine with a normal free T4 level.
medical_history.family_history: Family history significant for Graves disease in her mother; no family history of liver disease.
medical_history.social_history: Patient drinks 0â€“2 alcoholic beverages per month, has no history of drug use, and contracted HIV through heterosexual sex with a previous long-term partner.
